HDG.LOG.content: these meanings of legein, an event (Ereignis), concealed in long unnoticed simplicity, in transformation of word meanings > the original legein (Das ursprüngliche legein)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: these meanings of legein, an event (Ereignis), concealed in long unnoticed simplicity, in transformation of word meanings > the original legein (Das ursprüngliche legein)

HDG.LOG.content: a swarming multiplicity of meanings nestles (verschwimmende Mannigfaltigkeit von Bedeutungen nistet) in both these dangerously harmless words: en and panta [plurivocity over dissemination]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a swarming multiplicity of meanings nestles (verschwimmende Mannigfaltigkeit von Bedeutungen nistet) in both these dangerously harmless words: en and panta [plurivocity over dissemination]

HDG.LOG.content: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: thinking changes the world, changes world in ever darker depths of a riddle (Rätsel) > riddle propounded (zugesagt) to us [for a long time] in word “Being” > Being remains only the provisional (vorläufige) word [Being originally called “presencing (Anwesen),” enduring-here-before in unconcealment (her-vor-währen in die Unverborgenheit)] [truth and security, Wahrheit]

HDG.IM.content: “everything we have mentioned is” [canvas, brushstrokes, field, potato fires] > reach out to Being, reach out to void, Being almost like nothing > always trying to arm/guard ourselves against presumption of saying beings are not [why? exorcism]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: “everything we have mentioned is” [canvas, brushstrokes, field, potato fires] > reach out to Being, reach out to void, Being almost like nothing > always trying to arm/guard ourselves against presumption of saying beings are not [why? exorcism]

HDG.IM.content: we’ve fallen out of what word “Being” is saying > even if one can’t understand question of Being, even when asked in more originary way—question still inevitable
HDG.IM.linkedContent: we’ve fallen out of what word “Being” is saying > even if one can’t understand question of Being, even when asked in more originary way—question still inevitable

HDG.IM.content: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being
HDG.IM.linkedContent: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being

HDG.IM.content: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]

HDG.IM.content: we stand w/in a language that made Being a mere word, if we call it a fact, this is a provisional formulation [Vorläufigkeit] > still have not thought through, still coming to grips w/ this “fact” [so Nietzsche didn’t think it through?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: we stand w/in a language that made Being a mere word, if we call it a fact, this is a provisional formulation [Vorläufigkeit] > still have not thought through, still coming to grips w/ this “fact” [so Nietzsche didn’t think it through?]

HDG.IM.content: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: many (essential) words [transcendental signifier] are worn out, used up, abused—language in general is used up, masterless, as indifferent as means of public transportation [social media]

HDG.IM.content: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: emptiness of word “Being,” complete withering of its naming force, not just particular case of general abuse of language: the destroyed relation to Being as such [the name?] is real ground for whole misrelation to language [how do you know this if you haven’t answered Nietzsche yet?] [if it is exemplary, what does the particular name matter?]

HDG.BC.content: must know Greek language [authenticity] [but Heidegger against phony cultural inheritance] > knowledge of Greek no proof that he can think acc. the thought
HDG.BC.linkedContent: must know Greek language [authenticity] [but Heidegger against phony cultural inheritance] > knowledge of Greek no proof that he can think acc. the thought

HDG.BC.content: elucidation of what the Greek word says to us is not lacking [?] > German language: suited like no other for translating ancient Greek
HDG.BC.linkedContent: elucidation of what the Greek word says to us is not lacking [?] > German language: suited like no other for translating ancient Greek

HDG.BC.content: [method] attend to character of word rather than many examples (can be multiplied to infinity)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [method] attend to character of word rather than many examples (can be multiplied to infinity)

HDG.BC.content: “is” as connecting word must be totally “empty” [khōra] > “to be”: indispensable but fundamentally (im Grunde) empty representation
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “is” as connecting word must be totally “empty” [khōra] > “to be”: indispensable but fundamentally (im Grunde) empty representation

HDG.BC.content: avoid phantom of “being itself” in the word “being”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: avoid phantom of “being itself” in the word “being”

HDG.BC.content: “culture only exists insofar as it is plugged into (eingeschaltet) the operations that secure a basis for a form of domination” [what about Being’s security?] > [Heidegger congratulates himself on use of term from machine technology/utilization, like an automatic proof of actuality that finds words here] [method]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “culture only exists insofar as it is plugged into (eingeschaltet) the operations that secure a basis for a form of domination” [what about Being’s security?] > [Heidegger congratulates himself on use of term from machine technology/utilization, like an automatic proof of actuality that finds words here] [method]

HDG.BC.content: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [against science of history] interpret everything from what has been: human inertia

HDG.BC.content: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: capture “universal representation” in a word’s sound (“being”) [?] > uselessness of discussion of word “is,” something superfluous (Überflussiges), perhaps even an excess (Überfluss)

HDG.BC.content: against “grammar” imparting authoritative information about language/word > against hasty presumption/cleverness that contrives a worldview, “represents” a particular standpoint
HDG.BC.linkedContent: against “grammar” imparting authoritative information about language/word > against hasty presumption/cleverness that contrives a worldview, “represents” a particular standpoint

HDG.BC.content: we move w/in differentiation of being & beings [good summary of ontological difference] > [“is” method] that we must continually say “is”: being wants to be put into a word, one we always mis-hear
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we move w/in differentiation of being & beings [good summary of ontological difference] > [“is” method] that we must continually say “is”: being wants to be put into a word, one we always mis-hear

HDG.BC.content: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we have our residence in the distinction (Unterscheidung) btwn Being/beings [ontological difference] > ontological difference looks negative [isn’t], OD holds differentia apart (hält Unterscheidenes auseinander) [spacing], an extension & expanse, space of all spaces > at first, know nothing of this distinction, of what it consists remains hidden: in fact > whether code word (Kennwortes) “distinction” characterizes its essence remains undecided/unasked > “the distinction” more essential than all differences/oppositions btwn beings

HDG.BC.content: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords (Leitworte) > being is emptiest at same time surplus (Überfluss) > “is” indicates emptiness (Leere) (reflection [Nachdenken] can find no support [Anhalt]) & wealth (Reichtum) w/in which Being of beings pronounces (ausspricht) itself > w/ “is,” a surplus put into words [is this different w/ any other word? transcendental signifier]

HDG.BC.content: Being thoroughly common in all beings, thus most common [radical leveling of metaphysical privilege] > each being finds its equal (Being), can be compared (vergleichen), but Being never finds its equal, over & against all beings, unique, can’t be compared
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being thoroughly common in all beings, thus most common [radical leveling of metaphysical privilege] > each being finds its equal (Being), can be compared (vergleichen), but Being never finds its equal, over & against all beings, unique, can’t be compared

HDG.BC.content: we 1st depend on beings because released into beings, this dependence put into word, pervasive in “is,” “are”: in each “tense-word” of language we name being [“is” method] > Being said w/ every word, verbal articulation—if not named each time w/ its own name [?] > Being as pre-giving of what 1st permits naming of beings (not addition (Zugabe)/supplement (Beigabe) [cf. Derrida])
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we 1st depend on beings because released into beings, this dependence put into word, pervasive in “is,” “are”: in each “tense-word” of language we name being [“is” method] > Being said w/ every word, verbal articulation—if not named each time w/ its own name [?] > Being as pre-giving of what 1st permits naming of beings (not addition (Zugabe)/supplement (Beigabe) [cf. Derrida])

HDG.BC.content: instructions (Anweisungen) for reflection [askesis], procure modestly a preparation (Vorbereitung) for resolve to follow meleta to pan, to know what’s incipient in Western thought, what’s said in the inception > struck by word from inceptive saying: clearer readiness (Bereitschaft) for direction (Richtung) toward which we must listen
HDG.BC.linkedContent: instructions (Anweisungen) for reflection [askesis], procure modestly a preparation (Vorbereitung) for resolve to follow meleta to pan, to know what’s incipient in Western thought, what’s said in the inception > struck by word from inceptive saying: clearer readiness (Bereitschaft) for direction (Richtung) toward which we must listen

HDG.BC.content: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)
HDG.BC.linkedContent: no trace of intention not to say Being [for you either???], so keeping silent comes from Being itself (word arises from realm of silence)

HDG.BC.content: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: we know the organism human because we are this type [?] > [funny joke against “anthropology,” presumptuous titles, e.g. “Man”]

HDG.BC.content: [Heidegger against MOP] sight/sense for closest of all proximities suppressed by power of actual, latter presumed to become measure for each respective being & Being
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [Heidegger against MOP] sight/sense for closest of all proximities suppressed by power of actual, latter presumed to become measure for each respective being & Being

HDG.W.content: no word for this mystery, no Saying which could bring Being of language to language: “word for the being of the word is not granted”
HDG.W.linkedContent: no word for this mystery, no Saying which could bring Being of language to language: “word for the being of the word is not granted”

HDG.W.content: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings
HDG.W.linkedContent: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings

HDG.WM.content: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: science, submission to beings themselves, gives matter itself explicitly/solely first/last word: beings allowed to reveal themselves > human stance that guides science: irruption by one being called “human being” into whole of beings [Marx’s Gattungswesen]: through this irruption that breaks open beings show what/how they are [?]

HDG.WM.content: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)
HDG.WM.linkedContent: concession of nothing, always an empty squabble over words? > for science, nothing is an outrage/phantasm (wishes to know nothing about nothing)

HDG.IWM.content: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: if we adhere to customary usage (of words for Being: einai, esse) betray ourselves as pacemakers (Schrittmacher) of greatest thoughtlessness to have gained currency in human thought, has remained dominant until this moment > essence of presencing deeply concealed in early names for Being

HDG.QB.content: biological/anthropological domain that led Nietzsche’s path all too greatly astray [?] [Heidegger against conscious pride in Nietzsche?] [Sagi]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: biological/anthropological domain that led Nietzsche’s path all too greatly astray [?] [Heidegger against conscious pride in Nietzsche?] [Sagi]

HDG.QB.content: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [responding to Jünger on whether one doesn’t need certain concepts—only comprehension of an actuality] our concern not only w/ concepts of science but w/ fundamental words like Gestalt, domination (Herrschaft), representation (Repräsentation), power, will, value, security (Sicherheit), presence (Praesenz) (presencing [Anwesen]), nothing > fundamental words (Grundworten) of thinking are an other kind than metaphysical concepts > in latter: that which concepts (Begriffen) grasp (begreifen) same as this very grasping (Begreifen) [strange phrasing on the difference btwn forgetting fundamental words and using them unexamined]

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.QB.content: [clever] Heidegger, defending against accusation of his own nihilism, explains that aversion of thought is part of destiny of nihilism, essence of nihilism resides (beruhe) in oblivion of Being [does that mean essence of nihilism does not reside in Being?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [clever] Heidegger, defending against accusation of his own nihilism, explains that aversion of thought is part of destiny of nihilism, essence of nihilism resides (beruhe) in oblivion of Being [does that mean essence of nihilism does not reside in Being?]

HDG.QB.content: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: all Saying [of Being, of overcoming nihilism] proceeds awkwardly: must pass through essential ambiguity (Mehrdeutigkeit) of word, turn of phrase > ambiguity of Saying resides (beruht) in a play, the richer it unfolds, remains all the more rigorously maintained in concealed rule (in einer verborgenen Regel gehalten bleibt) [secret] > supreme law of Saying: freedom that frees us for ever playful jointure (allspielende Gefüge) [why jointure?] of never resting transformation (nie ruhenden Verwandlung)

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: to which words of Heraclitus should Erläuterung direct itself?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to which words of Heraclitus should Erläuterung direct itself?

HDG.FS.content: no dialectic in Heraclitus, though his word is its impetus > what began after him: that “which the morning first found”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no dialectic in Heraclitus, though his word is its impetus > what began after him: that “which the morning first found”

HDG.FS.content: kosmos is fire (pyr): (threefold sense) rising flame (aufsteigende Flamme), brooding glow (brütende Glut), radiating light (strahlendes Licht) > for Heraclitus (unlike modern man who reduces word to one meaning), this manifold richness is kosmos, never isolated, shimmers ungraspably through everything
HDG.FS.linkedContent: kosmos is fire (pyr): (threefold sense) rising flame (aufsteigende Flamme), brooding glow (brütende Glut), radiating light (strahlendes Licht) > for Heraclitus (unlike modern man who reduces word to one meaning), this manifold richness is kosmos, never isolated, shimmers ungraspably through everything

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

HDG.FS.content: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when Heidegger first attempts to exit prison of consciousness (in Being and Time), not restoring realism against idealism: realism (assurance a world exists for subject) dependent on Cartesianism [Heidegger attempting to think Greek sense of egō]

HDG.FS.content: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel uses word science (Wissenschaft) in Fichte’s sense, “System of Science,” system of philosophy, “Science”: philosophy become absolute knowledge (of subject)

HDG.FS.content: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: philosophy as an attempt at conjoining, Parmenides’ en, the being of beings, being not an empty word, exchangeable currency, always concretely apprehended as present (Gegenwart), as presence (Anwesenheit)—what is relation btwn presence/unity?

HDG.FS.content: work of seminar avoids merely historical questioning, protects itself against taking text as pretext for questions that would be “ours”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: work of seminar avoids merely historical questioning, protects itself against taking text as pretext for questions that would be “ours”

HDG.FS.content: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics
HDG.FS.linkedContent: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics

HDG.FS.content: Greeks lived immediately in openness of phenomena—through expressly ek-static capacity of letting phenomena speak to them (modern man, via Descartes, only talks to himself, human as representer), no Greek word for being of human in alētheia, not due to lack, but due to excess > belonging to alētheia as Greek destiny: moira
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Greeks lived immediately in openness of phenomena—through expressly ek-static capacity of letting phenomena speak to them (modern man, via Descartes, only talks to himself, human as representer), no Greek word for being of human in alētheia, not due to lack, but due to excess > belonging to alētheia as Greek destiny: moira

HDG.FS.content: Being and Time attempts to open a hearing for word of Being (not new signification [is that possible?]), let it be claimed (in Anspruch) by Being: to be the there, matter of becoming claimed by Being [attention of Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Being and Time attempts to open a hearing for word of Being (not new signification [is that possible?]), let it be claimed (in Anspruch) by Being: to be the there, matter of becoming claimed by Being [attention of Being]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger learned from Hölderlin uselessness of coining new words > information technology robbing language of its proper laws, mere instrument (Werkzeug) of information > [Heideggerian imperative] “untiringly work outside of all publicness (Öffentlichkeit) to keep alive (lebendig zu bewahren) a thinking that is attentive to being (ein dem Sein achtsames Denken)”: lay foundation (begründen) for distant future (ferne Zukunft), possibility of tradition (Überlieferung) [to come, arrival?]

HDG.FS.content: Sein: Nichts: Selbes? > essence of metaphysics: nothing metaphysical [overcoming metaphysics] > Heidegger’s word neither on side of beings, nor simply on that of being: speaks from where horizon of difference (Differenz) becomes visible: ontological difference as condition of possibility (Bedingung der Möglichkeit) for metaphysics [differance] > Heideggerian proposition (Aussage): is difference itself, speaks of difference w/out holding onto it, thus he has abandoned (verlassen) metaphysics
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Sein: Nichts: Selbes? > essence of metaphysics: nothing metaphysical [overcoming metaphysics] > Heidegger’s word neither on side of beings, nor simply on that of being: speaks from where horizon of difference (Differenz) becomes visible: ontological difference as condition of possibility (Bedingung der Möglichkeit) for metaphysics [differance] > Heideggerian proposition (Aussage): is difference itself, speaks of difference w/out holding onto it, thus he has abandoned (verlassen) metaphysics

HDG.FS.content: no “what stands against” in Greek, no Gegenstand, no “object,” only that which, from itself, presences
HDG.FS.linkedContent: no “what stands against” in Greek, no Gegenstand, no “object,” only that which, from itself, presences

HDG.FS.content: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])
HDG.FS.linkedContent: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

HDG.MA.content: decisive question: how can we tame vast atomic energies, secure mankind against their danger > technological advance will move faster & faster, can’t be stopped > man hasn’t made forces of technology [?], they’ve moved beyond his will, outgrown his capacity for decision
HDG.MA.linkedContent: decisive question: how can we tame vast atomic energies, secure mankind against their danger > technological advance will move faster & faster, can’t be stopped > man hasn’t made forces of technology [?], they’ve moved beyond his will, outgrown his capacity for decision

HDG.MA.content: defenselessness to superior power of technology? only if man abandons intention to pit meditative thinking against calculative thinking > unceasing demand of meditative thinking [infinitely demanding]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: defenselessness to superior power of technology? only if man abandons intention to pit meditative thinking against calculative thinking > unceasing demand of meditative thinking [infinitely demanding]

HDG.CCP.content: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: [Heidegger’s method of giving word new meaning, e.g. the region, so it names something else]

HDG.CCP.content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.CCP.content: a mysterious region where there’s nothing for which to be answerable [?] > because it’s the region of the word, answerable to itself alone > everything in best order, in region we stay, if it was no one’s doing
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: a mysterious region where there’s nothing for which to be answerable [?] > because it’s the region of the word, answerable to itself alone > everything in best order, in region we stay, if it was no one’s doing

HDG.CCP.content: nature of thinking can’t be said in a single word [still on path] > [scholar now keeps a word he is thinking secret, momentarily] was not my discovery, merely a scholarly thought: a historical reminder
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: nature of thinking can’t be said in a single word [still on path] > [scholar now keeps a word he is thinking secret, momentarily] was not my discovery, merely a scholarly thought: a historical reminder

HDG.DL.content: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding
HDG.DL.linkedContent: why did you not surrender (überliessen) name “Being?” give it its own name > how does one give a name to what he’s still searching for? > assign the naming word: constitutes finding

HDG.DL.content: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [on “language is the house of Being”] gives a hint (Wink) of nature of language > you’ve just said a freeing word (lösendes Wort) > Dann wäre der Wink der Grundzug des Wortes [the hint as the basic character of the word > but, p. 25 don’t let notion of hinting become guiding concept (Leitbegriff) (then we bundle up everything)] > Japaner senses (spüre) [trace] a kinship btwn phrase & a Japanese word [Koto ba, but at this point, remains unnamed]

HDG.DL.content: word of Japaner still withheld, will bring us an unexpected surprise (unverhoffte Überraschung)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: word of Japaner still withheld, will bring us an unexpected surprise (unverhoffte Überraschung)

HDG.DL.content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

HDG.DL.content: we’re all clumsy questioners (unbehlofener Frager) [following unwritten prescription (ungeschriebenen Vorschrift)], despite much care, keep overlooking essentials [arrival?] > we notice quite late our carelessness re: words, because language is more powerful/weightier than we are
HDG.DL.linkedContent: we’re all clumsy questioners (unbehlofener Frager) [following unwritten prescription (ungeschriebenen Vorschrift)], despite much care, keep overlooking essentials [arrival?] > we notice quite late our carelessness re: words, because language is more powerful/weightier than we are

HDG.DL.content: grace, Anmut, Greek charis, which is called tiktousa (brings forward & forth), like German word dichten, tihton > graciousness as the poetical, das Quellen der Botschaft des Entbergens der Zwiefalt
HDG.DL.linkedContent: grace, Anmut, Greek charis, which is called tiktousa (brings forward & forth), like German word dichten, tihton > graciousness as the poetical, das Quellen der Botschaft des Entbergens der Zwiefalt

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

HDG.LP.content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

HDG.LP.content: poet’s work is only a listening, it’s language becomes a saying after (nachsagenden) > poetry’s spoken word guards Gedicht, as that which remains, essential in it, unspoken > when the saying-after must listen, becomes more pious, i.e. fügsamer gegenüber dem Zuspruch des Pfades [more fittingly submissive re: the promptings of the path] [traces?]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: poet’s work is only a listening, it’s language becomes a saying after (nachsagenden) > poetry’s spoken word guards Gedicht, as that which remains, essential in it, unspoken > when the saying-after must listen, becomes more pious, i.e. fügsamer gegenüber dem Zuspruch des Pfades [more fittingly submissive re: the promptings of the path] [traces?]

HDG.WL.content: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend
HDG.WL.linkedContent: das Ereignis ereignet in seinem Er-äugen des Meschenwesens die Sterblichen [in beholding human nature, Ereignis makes mortals appropriate for…] > Ereignis releases man into his own: the sounding of the word > w/in the way, which belongs to essence of language, peculiar property of language is concealed: der Weg ist ereignend

HDG.WL.content: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective
HDG.WL.linkedContent: if to know means to see something in wholeness of its nature, we can’t see the nature of language as such, in the round, because we belong w/in Saying, can only say something by saying it after Saying > language is monologue [cf. MONL], has its structure in the Aufriss of Saying: 1) language alone speaks authentically 2) language speaks lonesomely (einsam) > the some in lonesome, the same, Greek hama, Gothic sama, thus lonesome: “same in what unites that which belongs together” > Saying is in need of being voiced in word [Being needs man] > man’s needed usage (Brauchen), his resaying (Nachsagen) of what he listens to, lies in that lack (Fehlen) that isn’t negative or defective

HDG.TC.content: answer (Antwort) is the counter-word (Gegenwort), but is the word?
HDG.TC.linkedContent: answer (Antwort) is the counter-word (Gegenwort), but is the word?

HDG.EC.content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil
HDG.EC.linkedContent: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

HDG.EC.content: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we won’t be tempted to get over the devastation, we’re guarding ourselves against getting over something (etwas fertig zu werden) > we’d rather learn to wait until (bis) our essence becomes free/noble, when it fits (fügen) aptly (schicklich) w/ the mystery of this destiny (dem Geheimnis dieses Geschickes) [arrival? total ambiguity btwn waiting for.. and becoming free], wait as though this Fügsame consists (bestehen) in waiting, as though waiting would have to outlast (überdauern) death

HDG.EC.content: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: we are used/needed ( as the string sounding the primordial play of the world, the most ancient provenance (Herkunft) > this instrument is aptly (shicklich) taken up/preserved (aufgehoben) im Veroborgenen > is not answer (Antwort), even in word (Wort), the selfsame as Gegenwart ——Gegenwart is related to time, Antwort related to word, so that time & word are more intimately kindred (verschwistert) than we have presaged (ahnen)

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger rails against those who “understand” only re: historical influences: nothing is expected of them, they care (sorgen) only about the pseudo (Pseudos)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger rails against those who “understand” only re: historical influences: nothing is expected of them, they care (sorgen) only about the pseudo (Pseudos)

HDG.OHF.content: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: re: Aristotle’s Peri Ermēneias, solely important [in this context] re: history of meaning of word: discourse (Rede) makes something accessible (zugänglich), brings out into open, ready to hand (vorhanden) > thus logos has distinctive possibility of alētheuein (being-true), making what was concealed unconcealed [comes to light through logos]

HDG.OHF.content: [on demands for and against types of presuppositions: cries of anxiety in face of philosophy]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [on demands for and against types of presuppositions: cries of anxiety in face of philosophy]

HDG.OHF.content: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]

HDG.OHF.content: self-world & culture not accidental misunderstandings of today, constantly there as analysis travels its proper path (eigentlichen Weg) > hermeneutics must constantly struggle against these 2 possible sidetracks
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: self-world & culture not accidental misunderstandings of today, constantly there as analysis travels its proper path (eigentlichen Weg) > hermeneutics must constantly struggle against these 2 possible sidetracks

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: objective scientific type of philosophy: proper refuge (Schutzwehr) in which Dasein protected from abysmal (bodenlosen) relativism, finds a secure foothold, brings objective possibility of more objective agreement (Übereinstimmung), “All of us…”, i.e. presents Dasein w/ tranquil certainty/security (ruhige Sicherheit) of general/unanimous “yes, I agree” [a force against snarl of worldviews, & rampant skepticism of our day] > when the system is dynamic has character of life itself, simultaneously universal & concrete [not subjective]

HDG.OHF.content: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: decisive for development (Ausbildung) of a forehaving: seeing Dasein in its everydayness (Alltäglichkeit) > [cf. p. 62] formal indication of forehaving, in average everydayness: factical life means being-in-a-world > what is meant by “world” by “in” by “being”? investigation of each word not piecemeal but one point of view on same unitary phenomenon [demonstrated in intuition?]

HDG.OHF.content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger warns against taking a so-called experience (Erlebnis), an isolated act, for plain experience (schlichte Erfahrung), as if the single experience unlocks the meaning of being-there, reality in general
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger warns against taking a so-called experience (Erlebnis), an isolated act, for plain experience (schlichte Erfahrung), as if the single experience unlocks the meaning of being-there, reality in general

HDG.OHF.content: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: authentic mode of being in world is caring, meaning: producing, putting in place, directing ourselves to tasks, taking into possession, preventing, protecting against loss, etc. > in caring, life approaches/addresses itself (anspricht sich) in a worldly man > caring always concerned about itself [auto-affection?]: not a reflexivity of caring back upon itself, no, caring meets up w/ itself in a worldy manner in the there it is encountering [from implicit to explicit] > to be in the how of such caring: Besorgnis (anxious concern and its apprehensions)

HDG.OHF.content: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Spinoza-like?] all the regions of everyday analysis aren’t to be read over against each other, but as definite modes of world’s being-encountered, each a specific character of the round-about (Um-Charakter)[everything here is condensed]
